paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Various ages, sex, and ethnicities; specific demographics not detailed.
patients.phenotype: ATTRm amyloidosis, predominantly affecting the heart.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most common variant in the US is Val122Ile, which occurs in ~3–4% of African Americans.
This variant leads to ATTR with a clinical onset approximately a decade earlier than that seen with ATTRwt.

functional_data.summary: Over 120 identified pathogenic mutations of the TTR gene.

variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of ATTRm varies significantly with genetic mutation, age at the time of onset, and geographical location.
key_quotes: ATTRm amyloidosis is an autosomal dominant condition with variable penetrance.
The phenotypic penetrance of ATTRm varies significantly with genetic mutation, age at the time of onset, and geographical location.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was comprehensive, focusing solely on the TTR gene.
